identified-content.person: BASMAJIAN, DR. JEANINE HERMINE (DR. JEANINE HERMINE BULAN)

block.p: Dr. Jeanine Hermine Basmajian and Dr. Erwin Joseph Bulan are to be married today by the Rev. Dominick J. Lagonegro at St. Columba Roman Catholic Church in Hopewell Junction, N.Y.
The bride, a cum laude graduate of Hamilton College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Cornell University, received medical degrees from the SUNY Health Science Center at Syracuse.
Dr. Jeanine Hermine Basmajian and Dr. Erwin Joseph Bulan are to be married today by the Rev. Dominick J. Lagonegro at St. Columba Roman Catholic Church in Hopewell Junction, N.Y.
The bride, a cum laude graduate of Hamilton College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Cornell University, received medical degrees from the SUNY Health Science Center at Syracuse.

Mrs. Bulan, 29, will continue using her name professionally. She is a chief resident in internal medicine at the Mount Sinai Medical Center in Manhattan. In July, she will become a general internist with the Mid-Atlantic Permanente Medical Group in Reston, Va. She is a daughter of Christina Basmajian and Dr. Armand Basmajian of Manhasset, N.Y. Her father is a dentist in East Elmhurst, Queens. Her mother coordinates public health education projects at the North Shore-Long Island Jewish Health System in Manhasset.

Dr. Bulan, 30, is a resident in plastic surgery at Georgetown University Medical Center in Washington. He is a son of Gloria Bulan and Dr. Manuel Bulan of Napanoch, N.Y. His father is an internist with the Ellenville (N.Y.) Medical Group.
